page.title: 04BELVEDERE by the Wind.
page.content: Now it's Autumn and I'm looking forward to blowing through Belvedere. I look, and should be above my favourite spot by now, but it's not there. Instead, are just rows of houses. The old sea-mens' home's land is a new estate where children ride on bikes making lots of noise and add to the traffic commotion, although the people don't seem to notice it. I pass through the village where the shops are swapped around. I'm getting lost. There are so many people about, it's not at all like thirty years ago. Where should I go? I wonder. Then I remember the doctors' beautiful gardens, surely they must still be there. But they're not, instead there are houses. Feeling very disillutioned with what has met my gaze, I blow away, to return perhaps another day. Will there be any changes? WHO KNOWS!
